gr.interamerican.bo2.utils
Class MatchingUtils

java.lang.Object
  gr.interamerican.bo2.utils.MatchingUtils

public class MatchingUtils
extends java.lang.Object

Utility class that provides various methods that match elements of different collections.

MatchingUtils

Method Detail

intersection

public static <K,L,R> java.util.Map<K,Pair<L,R>> intersection(java.util.Map<K,L> left,
                                                              java.util.Map<K,R> right)
Creates a map that contains pairs of values that exist in two different maps with the same key. The output map will have a keySet() that is the intersection of the key sets of the left and right maps. If the same key k, exists in both maps, then the output map will contain an entry that has k as key and as value a pair of the values associated with k in both maps.

Type Parameters:
K - Type of key.
L - Type of values of left map.
R - Type of values of right map.
Parameters:
left - Map that provides the left element of the pairs that are put in the output map.
right - Map that provides the right element of the pairs that are put in the output map.
Returns:
Returns a map that contains the pairs of values that have the same key in both maps.

intersection

public static <K,L,R> java.util.Map<K,Pair<L,R>> intersection(java.util.Set<L> leftSet,
                                                              java.lang.Class<L> leftClass,
                                                              java.lang.String leftProperty,
                                                              java.util.Set<R> rightSet,
                                                              java.lang.Class<R> rightClass,
                                                              java.lang.String rightProperty)
Creates a map that contains pairs of values that exist in two different maps with the same key. Each map maps each element of a set with the value of one of the element's properties as key. The output map will have a keySet() that is the intersection of the key sets of the left and right maps. If the same key k, exists in both maps, then the output map will contain an entry that has k as key and as value a pair of the values associated with k in both maps.

Type Parameters:
K - the type of both the left and right property
L - the type of the elements of the left set
R - the type of the elements of the right set
Parameters:
leftSet - input set
rightSet - input set
leftClass - type of elements of leftSet
rightClass - type of elements of rightSet
leftProperty - property of leftClass that will provide the keys for the left map
rightProperty - property of rightClass that will provide the keys for the right map
Returns:
returns a map that contains the pair values that have the same property value on both sets. Both left and right elements of each pair are not null.

intersection

public static <K,V> java.util.Map<K,Pair<V,V>> intersection(java.util.Set<V> leftSet,
                                                            java.util.Set<V> rightSet,
                                                            java.lang.Class<V> clazz,
                                                            java.lang.String property)
Creates a map that contains pairs of values that exist in two different maps with the same key. Each map maps each element of a set with the value of one of the element's properties as key. The output map will have a keySet() that is the intersection of the key sets of the left and right maps. If the same key k, exists in both maps, then the output map will contain an entry that has k as key and as value a pair of the values associated with k in both maps.

Type Parameters:
K - the type of both the left and right property
V - the type of the elements of the sets
Parameters:
leftSet - input set
rightSet - input set
clazz - type of elements of leftSet
property - Property to use for matching.
Returns:
returns a map that contains the pair values that have the same property value on both sets. Both left and right elements of each pair are not null.

union

public static <K,L,R> java.util.Map<K,Pair<L,R>> union(java.util.Map<K,L> left,
                                                       java.util.Map<K,R> right)
Creates a map that contains the pairs of matching values of the left and right maps. The output map will have a keySet() that is the union of the key sets of the left and right maps. This means that for every key that exists in either map, there will be an entry in the output map. This entry will have as value a pair that can have one of its elements null. If the left map does not contain the key, then the left element will be null. If the right map does not contain the key, then the right element of the pair will be null. In case a key is contained in the intersection of both keys, then the pair will not have any null element.

Type Parameters:
K - Type of key.
L - Type of values of left map.
R - Type of values of right map.
Parameters:
left - Map that provides the left element of the pairs that are put in the output map.
right - Map that provides the right element of the pairs that are put in the output map.
Returns:
Returns a map that contains the pairs of values that have the same key in both maps.

match

public static <L,R> java.util.List<Pair<L,R>> match(java.util.Set<L> keys,
                                                    java.util.List<Pair<L,R>> pairs)
Creates a list of pairs with all matching and non matching elements of a set of values and a collection of pairs. Example: Matching the set{1,2,3,4,5} with the following list of pairs: {[1,"x"], [1,"y"], [1,"z"], [3,"x"], [4,"y"], [6,"z"]} should give the following list of pairs: {[1,"x"], [1,"y"], [1,"z"], [3,"x"], [4,"y"], [null,"z"], [2, null], [5,null]}

Type Parameters:
L -
R -
Parameters:
keys -
pairs -
Returns:
Returns a list of pairs with all matching and non matching elements of a set of values and a collection of pairs.

match

public static <L,R> java.util.List<Pair<L,R>> match(java.util.Set<L> left,
                                                    java.util.Set<R> right,
                                                    MatchingRule<L,R> rule)
Creates a list of pairs with all matching and non matching elements of two sets based on a matching rule that matches an element of one set to one or more elements of the other set.
The process leaves the input sets intact.

Type Parameters:
L - type of left set elements
R - type of right set elements
Parameters:
left - the left set
right - the right set
rule - the matching rule
Returns:
returns a list of pairs with all matching and non matching elements of two sets

keyMatches

public static <K,L,R> java.util.Map<K,Pair<L,R>> keyMatches(java.util.Set<K> keys,
                                                            java.util.Map<K,L> left,
                                                            java.util.Map<K,R> right)
Creates a map that contains pairs of the values contained in two maps that match the keys contained in a specified set. This method always returns a Map that has its keySet() having exactly the same values as the specified set keys. There is no check of the contents of the pairs put in the output map. Each pair could have one or even both values (left and right) null if there is no match of a key in one or both specified maps.

Type Parameters:
K - Type of key.
L - Type of values of left map.
R - Type of values of right map.
Parameters:
keys - Set containing the keys of the output map.
left - Map that provides the left element of the pairs that are put in the output map.
right - Map that provides the right element of the pairs that are put in the output map.
Returns:
Returns a map containing all keys of the specified set of keys and values with the pairs of the values associated with each key in the left and right maps.

union

public static <K,L,R> java.util.Map<K,Pair<L,R>> union(java.util.Set<L> leftSet,
                                                       java.lang.Class<L> leftClass,
                                                       java.lang.String leftProperty,
                                                       java.util.Set<R> rightSet,
                                                       java.lang.Class<R> rightClass,
                                                       java.lang.String rightProperty)
Creates a map that contains the pairs of matching values of the left and right maps. Each map maps each element of a set with the value of one of the element's properties as key. The output map will have a keySet() that is the union of the key sets of the left and right maps. This means that for every key that exists in either map, there will be an entry in the output map. This entry will have as value a pair that can have one of its elements null. If the left map does not contain the key, then the left element will be null. If the right map does not contain the key, then the right element of the pair will be null. In case a key is contained in the intersection of both keys, then the pair will not have any null element.

Type Parameters:
K - the type of both the left and right property
L - the type of the elements of the left set
R - the type of the elements of the right set
Parameters:
leftSet - input set
rightSet - input set
leftClass - type of elements of leftSet
rightClass - type of elements of rightSet
leftProperty - property of leftClass that will provide the keys for the left map
rightProperty - property of rightClass that will provide the keys for the right map
Returns:
returns a map that contains the pair values that have the same property value on both sets. The left and right elements of each pair may be null.

matches

public static <S,T> java.util.List<T> matches(java.util.Collection<T> elements,
                                              S sample,
                                              MatchingRule<S,T> rule)
Creates a list with the elements of a collection that match with a sample according to a MatchingRule.

Type Parameters:
S - Type of sample object.
T - Type of elements in the collection.
Parameters:
elements - Collection with the objects that is scanned to find matches with the specified sample.
sample - Sample object that is used to check if the elements of the collection
rule - Matching rule.
Returns:
Returns a list with the elements of the collection that match with the sample according to the specified matching rule.

fullJoin

public static <L,R> java.util.List<Pair<L,R>> fullJoin(java.util.Collection<L> lefts,
                                                       java.util.Collection<R> rights)
Creates a list of pairs that contains all possible combinations of the elements of the left and right collections.

Type Parameters:
L - Type of elements in the left collection.
R - Type of elements in the right collection.
Parameters:
lefts -
rights -
Returns:
Returns a list of pairs that contains all possible combinations between the elements of the left and right collection.
